DOC.brief_title: Different Factors Affecting Patients With Newly Diagnosed Bladder Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To assess effect lifestyle factor ( e.g. , smoking , dietary habit , fluid intake , environmental exposure ) recurrence progression bladder cancer . - To assess impact selenium and/or vitamin E progression recurrence bladder cancer . - To study health-related quality life association recurrence progression bladder cancer . - To establish bladder cancer tissue bank comprise blood , urine , bladder tissue . - To study predictive effect molecular marker recurrence progression bladder cancer . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . The study base cohort patient newly detect bladder cancer 16 urological centre within West Midlands , commence late 2005 period 5 year . This research project consist 5 individual study : CRUK-BCPP-2005-01-COHORT , CRUK-BCPP-2005-01-MARKERS , CRUK-BCPP-2005-01-QOL , CRUK-BCPP-2005-01-TISSUE-BANK , CRUK-BCPP-2005-01-TREATMENT . Patients may participate individual study . Peer Reviewed Funded Endorsed Cancer Research UK .
